intro: Hieracium florentinum subsp. hirsuticeps, commonly known as the Hirsute Hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its subspecies name *hirsuticeps*. The plant produces yellow composite flowers, typical of the daisy family, which consist of both ray and disk florets. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows and grassy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
